comments.body: Consider bumping the version for the entire Alpakka project? The latest is 4.2.0. The jump from 3 to 4 is apparently ["not really a breaking change release."](https://github.com/pauldijou/jwt-scala/releases/tag/v4.0.0)
I created an issue https://github.com/akka/alpakka/issues/2580

comments.body: before releasing I think we should verify by using this version of alpakka-cassandra in akka-projection and akka-persistence-cassandra and verify that all netty versions are aligned

The Netty upgrade motivated the 2.10 to 2.11 update. https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-java-v2/pull/1692
By default Alpakka excludes the Netty client from the AWS connectors and uses Akka HTTP via https://github.com/matsluni/aws-spi-akka-http/

      "com.github.jnr" % "jnr-unixsocket" % "0.22" // BSD/ApacheV2/CPL/MIT as per https://github.com/akka/alpakka/issues/620#issuecomment-348727265

comments.body: Thanks for adding the missing license tag!

Whatâ€™s the fix they made? Iâ€™m wondering if they fixed a native buffer issue, in which case perhaps an alternate PR for this with consideration of using native buffers. Thereâ€™s a FixMe somewhere in this code with a ref to the bug...

Socket options weren't set correctly -- i.e. big endian was always used. This would cause buffer sizes to be quite wrong on intel arch: https://github.com/jnr/jnr-unixsocket/commit/aa2c1e43493edc9f6ca2af45a789a7bacbf196a1

https://github.com/jnr/jnr-unixsocket/issues/48 is still open though.
Just FYI I logged this a while ago: akka/akka#24030 to be able to do this at runtime as well.
Heh, thanks!

comments.body: That's an interesting one. strictly speaking I think that it might work when running with 2.4, because the library is compiled with an later akka version and we are only binary **backwards** compatible.

The problem was mixing Akka 2.4 and 2.5 versions. Without this exclusion rule and when alpakka is compiled with 2.4, `elasticmq-rest-sqs` would evict akka-stream and akka-actor to 2.5.1 version, but not akka-stream-testkit. Therefore we would end up with newer akka-actor and akka-stream and older akka-stream-testkit which would cause `NoClassDefFoundError` mentioned in the original ticket.

By adding this ExclusingRule, we deny any control over Akka version from this library and then we test with Akka 2.4 and Akka 2.5.
I understand. Yes, that's the best we can do, but I still think it's not completely safe to run that with 2.4.
This should go to `val S3 = ...`
